steps.title: Get out your ice cube tray and pour water into it.
steps.content: Get out your ice cube tray and pour water into it. Make sure you don't put too much water in, or else it will overflow and it will not work.

steps.title: Add in the food coloring.
steps.content: Add in the food coloring. The food coloring can be any color you want. The more drops you put in the darker it will be.

steps.title: Carefully put the ice cube tray in the freezer.
steps.content: Carefully put the ice cube tray in the freezer. Make sure no water spills out and the tray is in a secure place so it doesn't tip.

steps.title: Wait for about 1-5 hours.
steps.content: Wait for about 1-5 hours. The larger the ice cube tray, the longer the wait.

steps.title: Once you are sure the ice is completely frozen, take it out of the freezer and carefully remove the ice from the tray.
steps.content: Once you are sure the ice is completely frozen, take it out of the freezer and carefully remove the ice from the tray.

steps.title: Find a suitable container.
steps.content: Find a suitable container. This could be a cake bowl, a cake mold or other large container that can be placed in the freezer. Add a desired amount of water.

steps.title: Add a few squirts of food coloring.
steps.content: Add a few squirts of food coloring. Use color liquid food coloring, food dye or any other non-toxic food coloring. The more squirts/drops/amounts added, the darker the ice will look.

steps.title: Mix well.
steps.content: Mix well. Ensure that the food coloring is completely dissolved.

steps.title: Make room in the freezer for the bowl.
steps.content: Make room in the freezer for the bowl. Place in the freezer; take care not to spill it, as the coloring can stain any surfaces it falls on, including the freezer plastic.

steps.title: Check regularly.
steps.content: Check regularly. Check how the giant colored ice cube is freezing every hour or so.

steps.title: When the giant ice cube has frozen, remove the bowl from the freezer.
steps.content: When the giant ice cube has frozen, remove the bowl from the freezer. Tip it out of the bowl for use The ice may crack; this is normal.

steps.title: Play with it or use it.
steps.content: Play with it or use it. Dump it into a large punch bowl or give it to the kids or dogs to enjoy. You can even draw on pavement with a giant ice cube. Toss a giant colored ice cube around in the snow for a really fun toy that's easy to keep finding again. It'll last for ages.
